channel.title: deque on Hashnopolis
channel.description: Recent content in deque on Hashnopolis

item.title: Shortest Subarray With Sum at Least K
item.description: Return the length of the shortest, non-empty, contiguous subarray of A with sum at least K. If there is no non-empty subarray with sum at least K, return -1. Example 1 Input: A = [1], K = 1 Output: 1 Example 2 Input: A = [1,2], K = 4 Output: -1 Example 3 Input: A = [2,-1,2], K = 3 Output: 3 Note 1 <= A.length <= 50000 -10 ^ 5 <= A[i] <= 10 ^ 5 1 <= K <= 10 ^ 9 Solution (sliding window using pointers) This version exceeds time limit Time: O(N)

item.title: Sliding Window Maximum
item.description: Given an array nums, there is a sliding window of size k which is moving from the very left of the array to the very right. You can only see the k numbers in the window. Each time the sliding window moves right by one position. Return the max sliding window. Example: Input: nums = [1,3,-1,-3,5,3,6,7], and k = 3 Output: [3,3,5,5,6,7] Explanation: Window position Max --------------- ----- [1 3 -1] -3 5 3 6 7 3 1 [3 -1 -3] 5 3 6 7 3 1 3 [-1 -3 5] 3 6 7 5 1 3 -1 [-3 5 3] 6 7 5 1 3 -1 -3 [5 3 6] 7 6 1 3 -1 -3 5 [3 6 7] 7 Note: You may assume k is always valid, 1 ≤ k ≤ input array’s size for non-empty array.
